intro: Noccaea meyeri, commonly known as Meyer's honesty, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and its distinctive seed pods that split open when mature. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine environments. Noccaea meyeri is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
